p: These concentrations are at least 10‐fold lower than those resulting from the intake of perillaldehyde from citrus by‐products, when used in diets at concentrations of 10% for poultry and 20% for the other species (calculated to be 16 μg/kg bw for poultry, 18 μg/kg bw for pigs, 12 μg/kg bw for ruminants, 8 μg/kg bw for horses, 20 μg/kg bw for rabbit and 7 μg/kg bw for fish, see Section 3.2.2.3, Volatile components: perillaldehyde).
